thread.title: Best beer bar at sea? Norwegian Cruise Line now has a contender
thread.title_full: Best beer bar at sea? Norwegian Cruise Line now has a contender

title: Best beer bar at sea? Norwegian Cruise Line now has a contender
text:
The District Brew House on Norwegian Cruise Line new Norwegian Escape is being billed as the first craft beer hall at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The District Brew House on Norwegian Escape boasts 24 beers on tap as well as more than 50 others in bottles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The array of 24 taps behind the bar at the District Brew House on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An America flag made out of bottle caps adorns one wall of the District Brew House on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An electronic board behind the bar at the District Brew House on Norwegian Escape lists beers available. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Beers from around the world fill glass cases at the District Brew House on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Everything from the mass-market to the unusual can be found in the glass cases at the District Brew House on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The District Brew House offers 24 beers on tap as well as more than 50 in bottles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape boasts Norwegian Cruise Line's first craft beer-focused outpost, called the District Brew House Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide The District Brew House on Norwegian Cruise Line new Norwegian Escape is being billed as the first craft beer hall at sea. (Photo: Gene Sloan, USA TODAY)
1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE ABOARD THE NORWEGIAN ESCAPE -- Craft beer lovers, your ship has come in.
What's being billed as the first craft beer hall at sea officially opened this weekend on the Norwegian Escape , the giant new Norwegian Cruise Line vessel that is on its first voyage with paying passengers .
Dubbed The District Brew House, the venue was designed in partnership with Miami's two-year-old Wynwood Brewing Company and has its own keg room visible behind a glass wall, 24 beers on tap and more than 50 others in bottles.
"We're getting guests that are a lot more savvy about food and beverage, including beer," the Norwegian executive in charge of developing new food and beverage concepts, Wes Cort, told USA TODAY on Saturday during a pre-inaugural event for travel agents. "Craft beer isn't a phenomenon anymore. It's real."
USA TODAY
New giant cruise ship sets sail on maiden voyage
The cruise industry has been relatively slow to embrace the craft beer movement. On many ships, it's still hard to find anything beyond Heineken, Budweiser, Bud Light and other mass-market lagers.
Sitting at one of the bar-height tables at the District, Cort said delivering craft beers to always-on-the-move cruise ships isn't easy, particularly if it's to be on tap.
"The challenge is a lot of it is unpasteurized," he says. "It has a short shelf life. It has to be very delicately handled. It has to be refrigerated all the time."
But with demand soaring, Norwegian and other lines are figuring it out. The District has a state-of-the-art tap system, and part of the reason for including a keg room as a focal point right next to the bar is that it allows for short runs from keg to tap, Cort says. That helps ensure the beer is delivered in good order.
By Sunday night, when the first paying passengers were on board Escape, the District was hopping.
Wynwood's Pop's Porter, a Great American Beer Festival Gold Medal winner, was among the beers pouring out of the taps as a mostly European crowd watched rugby on the room's large screen televisions. Also on tap was an exclusive-to-Norwegian pale ale by the brewery called The District.
Still, the tap lineup isn't nearly as varied and exotic as what is found at craft beer-focused bars in the USA. A large number of the beers on tap this weekend were relatively conservative (and in some cases mass-produced) lagers. The list didn't contain a single India Pale Ale let alone one of the Double IPAs or more exotic, high-hopped brews so loved by craft beer fans.
But the bottled beer selection was more diverse, if still mostly lacking in higher-hopped craft beer classics, with selections from such small producers as California's Lagunitas Brewing Company, Pennsylvania's Victory Brewing Company, Colorado's New Belgium Brewing and New York's Brooklyn Brewery. Belgian ales by the likes of Chimay and St. Stefanus also were on hand.
Prices range from $5.95 to $8.95 for most beers, not including an automatic service charge of 18% that is added to tabs.
The District also serves a handful of gastropub-style plates for snacking as well as hand-crafted cocktails from Bar Lab's James Beard Award-nominated mixologists Gabriel Orta and Elad Zvi. Live music nightly, including sing-alongs, and a traditional photo booth round out the space.
USA TODAY Cruise this week is getting exclusive access among U.S. media outlets to Norwegian Escape. For our 'first look' tours of the ship's public areas and cabins, scroll through the carousels below.
Among the most notable features on Norwegian Escape's top deck is Aqua Park, a family-friendly fun zone billed as the largest of its kind at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park features Free Fall, touted as the fastest water slide at sea, and another slide that takes inner tubes designed for two -- a first for Norwegian. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Two passengers at a time can ride an inner tube down the Aqua Racer slide on the port side of the Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park (the big blue slide on the right in this picture). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park is being billed as the largest water park at sea. It has five water slides in all. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Free Fall water slides on the Norwegian Escape kick off with a near vertical drop over the side of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The water slide zone atop the Norwegian Escape includes a watery play area for children called the Kid's Aqua Park. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The hub of the Norwegian Escape's top deck is its main pool area located on Deck 16. The layout differs from the main pool areas of recent Norwegian ships; it features a double-decker bar and more room for lounge chairs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In another new twist, the Norwegian Escape has two large outdoor screens overlooking the main pool on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Waves pool bar on Deck 17 overlooks the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More lounge chairs line the sides of the ship on Deck 17. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A large portion of the read part of the Norwegian Escape's top deck is devoted to the largest ropes course at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers can walk 'The Plank' out over the side of the ship, eighteen decks above the sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers suit up in harnesses before climbing on to the ropes course on Deck 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Nine holes of miniature golf are among the attractions at the Sports Complex at the back of the Norwegian Escape on Deck 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape also is home to first bocce ball court at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A full basketball court also is part of the sports zone at the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the outdoor venues on Norwegian Escape is the first Margaritaville at sea. It's located near the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A circular opening on the Norwegian Escape provides a visual connection -- and stairway access -- between the restaurants and nightspots of Decks 6, 7 and 8 Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also returning on Norwegian Escape is Norwegian's signature French restaurant Le Bistro. It's located on Deck 6 in the same space as on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape boasts Norwegian Cruise Line's first craft beer-focused outpost, called the District Brew House Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The District Brew House offers 24 beers on tap as well as more than 50 in bottles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6, the Headliners Comedy Club is a lively spot in the evenings. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Headliners Comedy Club has a complete bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's main showroom, the Escape Theater, holds 900 passengers -- about 150 more than the main theaters on the Norwegian Breakaway and Norwegian Getaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on the Norwegian Escape is the Supper Club, which offers dinner shows. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Supper Club has plush banquet seating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mixx bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6 of the Norwegian Escape is Taste, one of three main dining rooms. It serves traditional cuisine with a contemporary flair. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A second main dining room is Savor, which offers classic dishes and a modern decor. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another of the three main dining rooms on Norwegian Escape is the Manhattan Room, which offers live music and dancing along with meals at dinnertime. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Escape is the Skyline Bar, located adjacent to the ship's casino on Deck 7 Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Skyline Bar is located in space that is home to a disco on earlier Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape has a large casino spread across Deck 7. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Escape Casino is larger than the casinos on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, spilling into space previously used for an Asian noodle bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spreading between Decks 6 and 7, the Norwegian Escape's centrally located Atrium is wider than its sister spaces on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway (the entire ship is about two meters wider, allowing for a number of larger venues) Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A popular meeting point on the ship is The Bar at the Atrium, located at the bottom of the ship's three-deck-high atrium near the Guest Services desk. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at O'Sheehan's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Escape is home to a lively pub called O'Sheehan's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's has several pool tables along with other popular bar amusements. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Skee-ball is among the attractions in a corner of the O'Sheehan's pub on Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen O'Sheehan's also is home two two bowling lanes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another new concept for Norwegian on the Norwegian Escape is Food Republic, a casual eatery with a mix of cuisines including sushi available from four stations. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers dining at Food Republic will order through iPads located at tables. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Food Republic offers seating overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The La Cucina Italian eatery found on previous Norwegian ship returns on Norwegian Escape on Deck 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on Norwegian Escape is Tobacco Road, a re-creation of a Miami landmark that closed in 2014. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A smoking room is located at the back of Tobacco Road. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on the Norwegian Escape is The Cellars, A Michael Mondavi Family Wine Bar -- Norwegian's first wine bar at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cellars wine bar takes the place of the Ice Bar found on recent Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cellars will serve Mondavi wines by the glass in a stylish setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape features celebrity chef's Jose Garces' first restaurant at sea, a Cuban eatery called Bayamo by Jose Garces. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Bayamo is the mojito-serving Sugarcane Mojito Bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deck 8 also is home to second eatery by celebrity chef Jose Garces called Pincho Tapas Bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Escape has a large Teppanyaki restaurant on Deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The aft portion of Deck 8 on the Norwegian Escape is home to a large duty free shopping area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape is home to the first Lacoste boutique at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape also offers the first Carolina Herrera boutique at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In a change from recent Norwegian ships, shopping stands have been designed into the sides of the corridor on Deck 8 instead of in the middle, improving traffic flow. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also at the base of Escape's atrium on Deck 6 is the Atrium Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Atrium Cafe serves espresso drinks for an extra charge and an array of pastries and bake goods. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape offers more than a dozen full-service restaurants, including Brazilian-style steakhouse Moderno Churrascaria. The eatery's specialty is grilled and slow-roasted meats that are carved tableside by passadors. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to Moderno Churrascaria on Deck 8 is Cagney's Steakhouse, a Norwegian signature that is priced a la carte with entrees ranging from $16 to $25. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Just off the Norwegian Escape's main pool on Deck 16 is the casual Garden Cafe eatery. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Garden Cafe serves a wide range of cuisine from in a buffet setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Garden Cafe chef lines up desserts for dinnertime. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen At the back of Deck 16 is Norwegian Escape's casual buffet eatery, the Garden Cafe Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Garden Cafe has its own bar area near the entrance from the main pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Chill Bar is incorporated into the first Margaritaville at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Hot tubs flank both sides of Spice H20. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the back of Deck 17 is Spice H2O, an adult-only outdoor retreat with lounge chairs, hot tubs and a waterfall grotto. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 17, Entourage is a lounge on the Norwegian Escape dedicated exclusively to teens. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other recent Norwegian ships, Norwegian Escape boasts an exclusive, multi-deck retreat for passengers in top suites called The Haven. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's private, magrodome-covered pool area features lounge chairs in and out of the water. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's magrodome-covered pool area also has two hot tubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Three decks high, The Haven on Norwegian Escape features two indoor lounge areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Lounge on Deck 17 has its own bar accessible only to passengers staying in a Haven suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the more upscale accommodations on the Norwegian Escape are its 14 The Haven Spa Suites, which are part of the ship's exclusive Haven complex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites measure 280 square feet (not including the balcony) and come with complimentary access to the Norwegian Escape's thermal spa area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among spa-like touches in The Haven Spa Suites is a personal hot tub-like bath built into the bedroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Spa Suites feature a large built-in armoire near the entrance among other storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Armoires in The Haven Spa Suites have room for hanging clothes and come with an umbrella for passenger use. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa suite bathrooms are large with double-faucet sinks and walk-in showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Suite bathrooms have a sleek, contemporary design. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape passengers will find free soft serve ice cream on Deck 16 inside the Garden Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 16, the Norwegian Escape's Fitness Center has floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to cardio machines, the Fitness Center is loaded with Technogym equipment as well as free weights. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Mandara Spa is located in a prime location at the front of the ship on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa on the Norwegian Escape has 24 treatment rooms including two for couples. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa on the Norwegian Escape is home to one of the largest thermal suites at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Overlooking the front of the ship, the Norwegian Escape's thermal suite has 33 heated lounge chairs, a sauna, salt room, steam room and a thalassotherapy pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa's thermal suite also features one of the first 'snow rooms' at sea, an icy space chilled to 14 degrees fahrenheit. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Mandara Spa is home to a hair and beauty salon. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Shore Excursions desk is located on Deck 6 just off the atrium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Ping Pong is among the amusements available on the top decks of Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers will find touch-screen electronic sign boards across the Norwegian Escape to direct them to entertainment, dining and other activities. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The 164,600-ton Norwegian Escape is Norwegian Cruise Line's largest ship ever. ©2015 Michel Verdure - www.verd Fullscreen Like this topic? Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Smaller than Haven Deluxe Owner's Suites but still grand are the Norwegian Escape's four Haven Owner's Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bedrooms have built-in storage areas on several walls. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Storage areas in Haven Penthouse bedrooms aer built with flat fronts and are almost unnoticeable when closed. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen When open, built-in storage areas in Haven Penthouses reveal lots of room for hanging clothes and shelving. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bathrooms have tubs with a view of the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse showers also have windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouse bathrooms boast a small built-in grooming station. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Penthouses have large balconies that are at least 30 square feet in size. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other recent Norwegian ships, Norwegian Escape boasts an exclusive, multi-deck retreat for passengers in top suites called The Haven. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven's magrodome-covered pool area also has two hot tubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Haven Lounge on Deck 17 has its own bar accessible only to passengers staying in a Haven suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also larger than standard cabins on the Norwegian Escape are its 20 Spa Mini Suites, which measure 205 square feet not including the balcony. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites come with access to the thermal suite in the Norwegian Escape's Mandara Spa. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have a desk area with a built-in miniature refrigerator. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Amenities in Spa Mini Suites include a coffee maker. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The desk area of Spa Mini Suites has three U.S.-style electric outlets and a single European-style outlet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have built-in armoires with room for hanging clothes, several shelves and a personal safe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites feature balconies measuring 30 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suites have larger bathrooms than the typical standard cabin on the Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spa Mini Suite bathrooms have a wide sink with two faucets, toilet and shower but no tub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen As with The Haven suites, Spa Mini Suite bathrooms are stocked with upscale Bvlgari toiletries. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are 308 Mini Suites in all on the Norwegian Escape, including Mini Suites specially designed for passengers with disabilities. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Mini Suites are spread across eight of Norwegian Escape's decks. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen This accessible Mini Suite on Deck10 (room 10918) has a built-in desk area and storage along one wall. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bathroom of an accessible Mini Suite. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the aft of the Norwegian Escape, this accessible Mini Suite features an unusually large balcony area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most common type of cabin on the Norwegian Escape is the standard Balcony cabin. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are 1,168 Balcony cabins on the Norwegian Escape spread over many decks. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins measure 172 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins feature built-in desk areas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins also have sofas. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The sofas of Balcony cabins feature storage along their bottoms. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabins have large built-in armoires with room for hanging clothes and shelving. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The built-in armoires in Balcony cabins also have personal safes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Balcony cabin bathrooms have a sink with a single faucet, toilet and shower. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower of a Balcony cabin. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian's last three vessels, the Norwegian Escape features a cluster of small Studio cabins for solo travelers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Measuring just 100 square feet, Studio cabins have a highly efficient layout that fits a full-size bed, storage areas, shower, sink and toilet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower in Studio cabins stands alone in one corner of the room. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Toilets in Studio cabins are in their own compartment. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Sliding doors along one wall of Studio rooms open to reveal hidden storage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape has 407 windowless "inside" cabins, many of which have pull-down bunks to create sleeping spots for four people. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Interior cabins on the Norwegian Escape measure from 130 to 150 square feet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Interior cabins have a single narrow built-in storage unit. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The built-in storage unit in interior cabins has room for hanging clothes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Interior cabin bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shower in an interior cabin bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape also has Oceanview cabins (cabins with windows but no balconies). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An Oceanview cabin shower.
